meanings.definition: The bottom part of a shoe that provides traction.
meanings.sent1: I need to replace the worn slipsole on my shoe.
meanings.sent2: The slipsole of the shoe prevented me from slipping on the wet floor.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy mistook the slipsole for a chew toy.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was a slipsole, keeping her steady in uncertain times.
meanings.sent5: The rugged slipsole left imprints on the sandy beach.

meanings.definition: A type of shoe with a slipsole bottom.
meanings.sent1: She bought a new pair of slipsole shoes for hiking.
meanings.sent2: The slipsole shoes were comfortable for long walks.
meanings.sent3: The fashion-forward trendsetter flaunted her slipsole footwear.
meanings.sent4: His slipsole shoes were like clouds under his feet.
meanings.sent5: The slipsole shoes were a lifesaver during the rainy season.

meanings.definition: To attach a slipsole to a shoe.
meanings.sent1: The cobbler will slipsole my favorite boots.
meanings.sent2: I learned how to slipsole shoes in my shoemaking class.
meanings.sent3: He tried to slipsole his sneakers with duct tape, but it didn't work.
meanings.sent4: She slipsoled the new soles onto the old shoes with precision.
meanings.sent5: The shoemaker carefully slipsoled the custom-made shoes for the customer.
